titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ تَعَمَّمَ وَ لَمْ يَتَحَنَّكْ فَأَصَابَهُ دَاءٌ لَا دَوَاءَ لَهُ فَلَا يَلُومَنَّ إِلَّا نَفْسَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from the one who mentioned it, (It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘The one who wears a turban and does not Tahannak it (lets one end hang in front and the other at the back), so an illness strikes him and there is no cure for it, so he should not blame anyone except for himself’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَبِي هَمَّامٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي قَوْلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ مُسَوِّمِينَ قَالَ الْعَمَائِمُ اعْتَمَّ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) فَسَدَلَهَا مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَ مِنْ خَلْفِهِ وَ اعْتَمَّ جَبْرَئِيلُ فَسَدَلَهَا مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَ مِنْ خَلْفِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, form Abu Hamman, (It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassanasws regarding the Words of Allahazwj Mighty and Majestic [3:125] marked Angels. Heasws said: ‘The turbans which Rasool-Allahsaww wore, so hesaww let it loose from in front of himsaww, and from behind himsaww, and Jibraeelas wore it letting it loose from in front of himas and from behind himas’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَمِيلَةَ عَنْ جَابِرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ كَانَتْ عَلَى الْمَلَائِكَةِ الْعَمَائِمُ الْبِيضُ الْمُرْسَلَةُ يَوْمَ بَدْرٍ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from Abu Jameela, from Jabir, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There were white turbans upon the Angels Sent on the Day of Badr’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْعُقَيْلِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي عَلِيٍّ اللَّهَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ عَمَّمَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) عَلِيّاً ( عليه السلام ) بِيَدِهِ فَسَدَلَهَا مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَ قَصَّرَهَا مِنْ خَلْفِهِ قَدْرَ أَرْبَعِ أَصَابِعَ ثُمَّ قَالَ أَدْبِرْ فَأَدْبَرَ ثُمَّ قَالَ أَقْبِلْ فَأَقْبَلَ ثُمَّ قَالَ هَكَذَا تِيجَانُ الْمَلَائِكَةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from Al Husayn Bin Ali Al Uqayli, from Ali Bin Abdu Ali Al Lahby, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> put on the turban on Ali<sup>asws</sup> by his<sup>saww</sup> hand, so he<sup>saww</sup> let it hang from in front of him, and shortened it from behind him of the measurement of four fingers, then said: ‘Turn around’. So he<sup>asws</sup> turned. Then he<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Face me<sup>saww</sup>’. So he<sup>asws</sup> faced. Then he<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘This is how the Angels are crowned’.

verses.text:
عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) الْعَمَائِمُ تِيجَانُ الْعَرَبِ .
وَ رُوِيَ أَنَّ الطَّابِقِيَّةَ عِمَّةُ إِبْلِيسَ لَعَنَهُ اللَّهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The turbans are the crowns of the Arabs’.
And it is reported that layering (without letting one end hang in front and the other hang at the back) is a turban of Iblees<sup>la</sup>, may Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Curse him<sup>la</sup>’.

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ رَفَعَهُ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ خَرَجَ مِنْ مَنْزِلِهِ مُعْتَمّاً تَحْتَ حَنَكِهِ يُرِيدُ سَفَراً لَمْ يُصِبْهُ فِي سَفَرِهِ سَرَقٌ وَ لَا حَرَقٌ وَ لَا مَكْرُوهٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from one of his companions, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, 
(It has been narrated) raising it to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who goes out from his house wearing a turban (passing) beneath his chin, intending a journey, would neither be hit during his journey by theft, nor by burning, nor by abhorrence’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ الْبَغْدَادِيِّ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ عِيسَى بْنِ حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنِ اعْتَمَّ فَلَمْ يُدِرِ الْعِمَامَةَ تَحْتَ حَنَكِهِ فَأَصَابَهُ أَلَمٌ لَا دَوَاءَ لَهُ فَلَا يَلُومَنَّ إِلَّا نَفْسَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Musa Bin Ja’far Al Baghdady, from Amro Bin Saeed, from Isa Bin Hamza, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who wears a turban, so he does not circle it beneath his chin, and a sickness hits him for which there is no cure for it, so he should not blame anyone except for himself’.
